summary: This is an email chain from July 26, 2019, between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel and defense attorneys regarding scheduling a call about the Jeffrey Epstein case in the Southern District of New York. It references prior meetings and coordination among legal teams.

persons.name: Daniel J. Kaiser
persons.context: Attorney from Kaiser Saurborn & Mair, P.C., involved in the Epstein case, coordinating call scheduling with prosecutors. He is in Boston for a deposition but available to speak.

persons.name: Kimberly Lerner
persons.context: Recipient of email, attending a charity function, suggesting a Monday call time.

persons.name: Brad
persons.context: Attorney who represents a client (likely a victim or witness) in the Epstein case but is currently out of the country; alternative is to contact Stan.

persons.name: Stan
persons.context: Attorney who also represents the same client as Brad but wouldn't ordinarily be the primary contact; considered as an alternative point of contact.

persons.name: Dan
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York, part of the prosecution team on the Epstein case, seeking to schedule a call with defense attorneys.

persons.name: William H. Kaiser
persons.context: Recipient of an email from Daniel J. Kaiser on July 14, 2019, thanking for handling a meeting professionally.

connections.description: Prosecutor (Dan) and defense attorney (Daniel J. Kaiser) communicating to schedule a call regarding the Epstein case, indicating ongoing legal proceedings.
Both attorneys represent the same client in the Epstein case, with Brad being the primary and Stan as an alternative contact.
Daniel J. Kaiser sends a thank-you email to William H. Kaiser regarding a professionally handled meeting, likely within the same legal firm or network.

events.title: Prosecution Request for Call
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Dan emails defense attorneys Daniel J. Kaiser and Kimberly Lerner requesting a brief call about the Epstein case.

events.title: Meeting Between Legal Teams
events.description: A meeting occurred between the prosecution and defense teams regarding the Epstein case, followed by a thank-you email from Daniel J. Kaiser.

keyFacts: The email chain shows active coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) and defense attorneys regarding the Epstein case in late July 2019.
It references a prior meeting that took place around July 13, 2019, indicating ongoing legal discussions.
The correspondence involves scheduling urgency, with a note that 'it cannot wait until Monday' (July 29, 2019).
Multiple attorneys are involved in representing a client (likely a victim or witness), with Brad being primary but out of the country, and Stan as a backup.
The document is part of a series (references EFTA00096227 and EFTA00096228) of legal communications in the Epstein case.
